main event: The report describes an unidentified aerial object sighted over Minneapolis, Minnesota on multiple occasions in 1948 and 1949.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright, flame-colored orb approximately 6 feet in diameter that traveled at low speeds of around 5 miles per hour.
The object was observed to follow a straight, horizontal course and sometimes break up into smaller parts or disappear behind cloud cover.
One sighting occurred on October 20, 1948 and was observed by an airline telephone operator for about 3 minutes.
Another sighting on October 21, 1948 was reported in the Minneapolis Morning Tribune, describing a slow-moving object that broke up into numerous bright particles.
The reports indicate the objects exhibited unusual flight characteristics and behaviors that did not match known aircraft.
sighted object: Bright, flame-colored orb approximately 6 feet in diameter
witnesses: Airline telephone operator, other unidentified observers
photographs: No photographs were included in the reports
